title: New trailer drops for 'The Mandalorian,' Disney+ original Star Wars series
text:
New trailer drops for 'The Mandalorian,' Disney+ original Star Wars series originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

"Mandalorian, look outside. They're waiting for you."

A brand new trailer for "The Mandalorian," the original "Star Wars" series coming to Disney+, dropped Monday night ahead of its Nov. 12 premiere.

"The Mandalorian" is Lucasfilm's first live-action series. Jon Favreau's anticipated "Star Wars" spinoff series is set after the fall of the Empire but before the emergence of the First Order and follows the travails of a lone gunfighter in the outer reaches of the galaxy far from the authority of the New Republic.

After the stories of Jango and Boba Fett, another warrior emerges in the "Star Wars" universe.

"Mandalorian, look outside. They're waiting for you." Watch the brand new trailer for #TheMandalorian, an original Star Wars series. Start streaming Nov. 12, only on #DisneyPlus. pic.twitter.com/Ac38wozhZz — The Mandalorian (@themandalorian) October 29, 2019

(READ MORE: Here's 'basically everything' debuting on Disney+ on November 12)

The trailer has over 2 million views and counting.

"The Mandalorian" is one highly anticipated new title debuting on Disney+ on Nov. 12, and the library will also include Disney classics from 1937 to present day, from "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs" to "Aladdin," "Moana," as well as Disney Channel mainstays, like "Lizzie McGuire," the original "Duck Tales," "High School Musical" and more.

The service will be the exclusive streaming home for films released in 2019 and beyond, including "Captain Marvel," "Avengers: Endgame," "Frozen 2" and "Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker."

You can preorder the streaming service at DisneyPlus.com.

Disney is the parent company of ABC News and "Good Morning America."
